article_title: Idaho’s wait erodes projected savings from expanding Medicaid
article_text:
State delay, savings from health insurance exchange change the forecast

10-year projection was $173 million savings

Now, with more expensive “out” years, a $187 million cost

article_metadata.title: Idaho’s wait erodes projected savings from expanding Medicaid | Idaho Statesman

og.description: A 2014 estimate of $173 million savings to state and local governments that Idaho could realize over 10 years from Medicaid expansion has now dissolved. The latest projections now say expansion would cost the $187 million. The swing is due to the state missing some early-year savings, and the fact that Obamacare is costing less to cover the uninsured. The argument that expansion would improve the lives for 78,000 Idaho who would get access to health care at a bargain cost (borne mostly by the federal government) has not changed. But the case that expansion would benefit Idaho governments’ bottom line has.
